intro: Rondeletia aspera, commonly known as the rough rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The rough texture of its stems and leaves gives it its common name.
